Classic Chicken Alfredo Pasta

Jump to Recipe

If you're looking for a classic dish that never goes out of style, look no further than Chicken Alfredo Pasta. This creamy, rich pasta dish combines tender fettuccine noodles with succulent chicken breast, all enveloped in a velvety sauce made from heavy cream and Parmesan cheese. Perfect for a cozy dinner at home or an impressive meal for guests, Chicken Alfredo is a versatile recipe that can be enjoyed any night of the week. With just a handful of ingredients, including garlic for flavor and parsley for a fresh garnish, you can whip up this Italian favorite in no time. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned cook, this Chicken Alfredo recipe will elevate your pasta game and satisfy your cravings for comfort food. So grab your apron and let's dive into this deliciously creamy Chicken Alfredo Pasta!

Ingredients

fettuccine pasta

Use fresh fettuccine for a softer texture, or substitute with linguine or tagliatelle if you can't find fettuccine. For a gluten-free option, try brown rice or quinoa pasta. Always cook the pasta al dente to maintain a firm texture.

chicken breast

Consider marinating the chicken in lemon juice, olive oil, and herbs for extra flavor. If you prefer dark meat, chicken thighs can be a great substitute. Make sure to let the chicken rest after cooking to retain juices.

heavy cream

For a lighter version, you can use half-and-half or a blend of milk and cream, but this may result in a thinner sauce. Additionally, coconut cream can be a dairy-free alternative. Always heat the cream gently to prevent it from curdling.

parmesan cheese

Use freshly grated Parmesan for the best flavor and texture. If you're out of Parmesan, Pecorino Romano can be a good substitute, though it's saltier. Nutritional yeast is a great vegan alternative that adds a cheesy flavor.

garlic

Roast the garlic before adding it to the sauce for a sweeter, more mellow flavor. If you want a stronger taste, consider adding more garlic or using garlic powder. Garlic-infused oil can also be used for a subtler flavor.

olive oil

Extra virgin olive oil provides a richer flavor; however, you can substitute with canola or avocado oil for a neutral taste. For added flavor, consider infusing the oil with herbs or garlic before cooking.

salt

Start with a small amount of salt and taste as you go, especially after adding the cheese, which can be salty. For a different flavor, try using sea salt or kosher salt.

black pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper offers the best flavor. If you prefer a bit of heat, consider adding white pepper or a pinch of red pepper flakes for a kick.

parsley

Fresh parsley adds a bright, fresh flavor; however, you can substitute with basil or chives for a different herbaceous note. For added color, consider using chopped sun-dried tomatoes or arugula as a garnish.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Cook the fettuccine pasta

    Begin by boiling a large pot of salted water. Add 8 ounces of fettuccine pasta and cook according to the package instructions until al dente, usually about 8-10 minutes. Make sure to stir occasionally to prevent sticking. Once cooked, drain the pasta in a colander and set it aside. Expert Tip: Always taste a strand of pasta a minute or two before the recommended cooking time to ensure it’s cooked just right. It should be firm to the bite.

  • Step 2: Prepare the chicken breasts

    While the pasta is cooking, season 2 pieces of chicken breast on both sides with salt and black pepper. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, add the chicken breasts. Cook for about 6-7 minutes on each side, or until the chicken is golden brown and cooked through (an internal temperature of 165°F). Remove from the skillet and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing. Expert Tip: Letting the chicken rest allows the juices to redistribute, making it juicier and more flavorful.

  • Step 3: Make the Alfredo sauce

    In the same skillet used for the chicken, add 2 cloves of minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant (be careful not to burn it). Then, pour in 1 cup of heavy cream and bring it to a gentle simmer, stirring frequently. Expert Tip: Use fresh garlic for the best flavor. You can also add a pinch of red pepper flakes for a little heat!

  • Step 4: Combine cheese and season

    Once the cream is simmering, gradually stir in 1 cup of grated Parmesan cheese. Continue stirring until the cheese melts and the sauce thickens. Taste the sauce and season with additional salt and black pepper as needed. Expert Tip: For an extra creamy sauce, you can add a tablespoon of butter along with the cheese!

  • Step 5: Combine pasta and sauce

    Add the drained fettuccine to the Alfredo sauce in the skillet. Toss the pasta gently to coat it evenly with the creamy sauce. Expert Tip: If the sauce is too thick, you can add a splash of reserved pasta cooking water to help loosen it.

  • Step 6: Serve and garnish

    Slice the rested chicken breasts and arrange them on top of the pasta. Garnish with freshly chopped parsley for a pop of color and fresh flavor. Serve immediately while hot. Expert Tip: Pair your Chicken Alfredo with a crisp salad or garlic bread for a complete meal.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I know when the pasta is cooked al dente?

Al dente means 'to the tooth.' To check, taste a piece of pasta a minute or two before the package's cooking time is up. It should be firm but not hard, with a slight bite.

How should I prepare chicken breasts before cooking?

Pat the chicken breasts dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture. This helps achieve a nice sear. You can also pound them to an even thickness for more uniform cooking.

What is the best way to slice cooked chicken?

Let the chicken rest for a few minutes after cooking. Then, use a sharp knife to slice against the grain. This makes the chicken tender and easier to chew.

How do I ensure my garlic doesn't burn when sautéing?

Garlic can burn quickly, which makes it bitter. Cook it over medium heat and stir frequently. Add the garlic to the pan after it has heated, and keep an eye on it to avoid burning.

What can I do if my sauce is too thick?

If your Alfredo sauce becomes too thick, you can add a little bit of reserved pasta water or extra heavy cream to loosen it up. Stir well until you reach your desired consistency.

How do I properly season my dish?

Start with a little salt and pepper, then taste as you go. You can always add more, but it's hard to fix an over-seasoned dish. Consider the seasoning of each component as you cook.

What is the best way to store leftovers?

Allow the pasta to cool completely before transferring it to an airtight container. Store in the fridge for up to 3 days. To reheat, add a splash of water or cream to keep it moist.

Can I use a different type of pasta for this recipe?

Absolutely! While fettuccine is traditional for Alfredo, you can use any pasta you like, such as penne, linguine, or even spiral shapes. Just adjust the cooking time accordingly.

How can I add more flavor to my Alfredo sauce?

You can add a pinch of nutmeg, a splash of white wine, or even sautéed mushrooms for extra depth. Fresh herbs like basil or thyme can also enhance the flavor.

Is there a way to make this dish healthier?

You can use whole grain pasta for added fiber, substitute half of the heavy cream with low-fat milk, or include sautéed vegetables like spinach or broccoli to increase nutrition.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a lighter version, substitute the heavy cream with half-and-half or a non-dairy alternative like cashew cream. To accommodate gluten-free diets, use gluten-free fettuccine pasta. For a lower-carb option, zucchini noodles can be used. If you're looking to reduce calories, use grilled chicken or turkey instead of traditional chicken breast.

Pairings

For a delightful meal experience, pair the Chicken Alfredo Pasta with a crisp side salad dressed with a light vinaigrette, such as a lemon or balsamic dressing, which complements the richness of the Alfredo sauce. Additionally, serve with garlic bread or a warm baguette to soak up the creamy sauce. For beverages, a chilled glass of Chardonnay or a light Italian Pinot Grigio enhances the flavors, while sparkling water with lemon adds a refreshing touch.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Chicken Alfredo Pasta in warm bowls to maintain the temperature. For an elegant touch, sprinkle a bit more grated Parmesan and freshly chopped parsley on top just before serving. To elevate the experience, consider adding a sprinkle of red pepper flakes for a hint of heat or a drizzle of truffle oil for an added depth of flavor.

Classic Chicken Alfredo Pasta

30 min
$15
600 kcal
Difficulty: 30%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

DairyGluten

Dietary Tags:

High ProteinComfort Food

Cuisine:

Italian

Course:

Main Course

Tags:

PastaItalianQuick Meal

Description

Creamy, cheesy Alfredo sauce enveloping tender chicken and pasta for a comforting meal.

Ingredients

  • fettuccine pasta: 8 ounces
  • chicken breast: 2 pieces
  • heavy cream: 1 cup
  • parmesan cheese: 1 cup, grated
  • garlic: 2 cloves, minced
  • olive oil: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: to taste
  • black pepper: to taste
  • parsley: for garnish

Date Created:

11/18/2024
